newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain's Pujol says budget talks have "blockages".
newsitem.headline: Spain's Pujol says budget talks have "blockages".

text.p: Jordi Pujol, leader of the Catalan regional coalition supporting Spain's governing Popular Party, said on Thursday there were "blockages" in talks on the 1997 budget.
But both sides were willing to reach an agreement, he added.
"At the moment there's a blockage in talks on health and the blockage is important. This isn't a spectacular political fact, but it is important," Pujol told Spanish radio station SER.
The government budget draft must be presented to parliament by the end of the month. The cabinet is set to approve the draft on September 27.

Pujol, who leads the Convergence and Unity (CiU) coalition, said talks with the central government would take several days, but added that "there is the will, the sincere and firm desire on the part of the government and CiU to secure a budget for Spain."
